12.text:
Hello, I'm Lizzie. Today I've got a story
that dates back thousands of years. It involves

19.text:
a man who's a sculptor and who, through his
skilful work, hopes to find the perfect woman.

26.text:
This man is called Pygmalion. A group of prostitutes
are in the street, not behaving very well.

34.text:
These women have been punished by the goddess
Aphrodite, for not believing in her, by removing

38.text:
their inhibitions - and their wild behaviour
is driving him around the bend.

44.text:
Pygmalion is not impressed. He hasn't met
many women but soon he comes round to the

50.text:
idea that this is how all women behave and
decides that he's going to ignore all women

58.text:
Instead of talking to and meeting women, he
decides to 'make' his ideal woman by carefully

65.text:
and delicately sculpturing an ivory statue.
He works his way round and round the block,

72.text: chiselling and carving away at pieces.

75.text:
He works round the clock until eventually
he creates a beautiful sculpture. In fact

81.text:
it is so lifelike that Pygmalion actually
falls in love with the statue, almost believing

88.text:
it is human. He kisses it all over - yuk!
But, sadly, the statue will never love him back.

98.text:
What's the point in having an ivory statue
to love? Join me for the next part to find out.
